thread.title: South Ockenden puppy farm gang spared jail over £300k fraud
thread.title_full: South Ockenden puppy farm gang spared jail over £300k fraud

title: South Ockenden puppy farm gang spared jail over £300k fraud
text:
South Ockenden puppy farm gang spared jail over £300k fraud 1 February 2017 Image copyright Peter Lawson/East News Agency Image caption Teresa Wade was given a 21-month prison sentence suspended for two years. A gang of puppy farmers which sold hundreds of dogs kept inside cages has been spared jail. 
Teresa Wade, 57, Victoria Montgomery, 54, her daughter Roxanne Montgomery, 33, and Tony Hammond, 34, were convicted in October . 
They handled about 750 puppies as part of a "sophisticated conspiracy" at a farm in South Ockendon, Essex. 
Each member was given a suspended prison sentence at Basildon Crown Court. 
The RSPCA said the fraud was worth more than £300,000. Image copyright RSPCA Image caption The dogs - some barely two weeks old - had soiled newspapers for bedding, no toys and some had no heating Image copyright RSPCA Image caption Some of the animals were so sick they died shortly after arriving at their new homes
